Scala Expressions and Functions
As opposed to instructions, everything in Scala is considered an
expression
. Even if/else statements themselves in Scala are expressions.
For Loops
For loops are not recommended in Scala. They return
Unit
which in itself is equivalent to
null
. This is the case for side effects - an intergral part of understanding Scala.
Code Blocks
Note that if you write a code block, the last value in the code block is returned as the value.
Examples of Expressions and Side Effects
Functions
export const _frontmatter = {}
